description: Raising of roof height ,'piggyback' style, side dormer roof extension, and installation of 6no x. rooflights to facilitate loft conversion, including a new front window at second floor, to provide 1no x 1 bedroom self-contained flat.
decision_conditions: Prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted, the following details shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented prior to the occupation of the development and retained as such for the life of the development. (a)  cycle store facilities (materials, design and dimensions)Reason: To provide adequate cycle store facilities in accordance with Policy 6.9 of the London Plan and  Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted, the following details shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented prior to the occupation of the development and retained as such for the life of the development. (a)  refuse and recycling store facilities (materials, design and dimensions)Reason: To provide adequate refuse and recycling facilities in accordance with  Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason:  As required  by Section 91 of  the Town  and Country Planning  Act  1990,  as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby approved  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  the  materials  specified  on  the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Condition 22 Amenity Space Management Plan -The applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above, are agreed and that Condition 22 Amenity Space Management Plan of planning permission 19/01228/FUL is hereby discharged subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the details hereby approved.

Condition 23 Childrens Play Spaces -The applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above, are agreed and that Condition 23 Childrens Play Spaces of planning permission 19/01228/FUL is hereby discharged subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the details hereby approved.The development shall not be occupied until the children's play spaces have been laid out and play equipment installed in accordance with a scheme to be first submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. This shall include details of design, materials and target age group. The play spaces and equipment shall be retained for their intended purpose for the lifetime of the development.Reasons: In the interests of the amenities of the future occupants in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012

With respect to any proposals for piling through made ground, we would refer you to the Environment Agency guidance document "Piling and Penetrative Ground Improvement Methods on Land Affected by Contamination: Guidance on Pollution Prevention" (NGWCL Centre Project NC/99/73).

A water discharge permit may be required for discharge of water to the surface water network or main river from any piling or construction dewatering activities. Please refer to the following guidance:https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/temporary-dewatering-from-excavations-to-surface-water/temporary-dewatering-from-excavations-to-surface-waterIf you wish to discharge effluent after appropriately treating it to groundwater or surface water please contact the Environment Agency (Tel: 03708 506 506) as a permit under the Environmental Permit Regulations will be required.

The submitted location plan does not have a red outline in the proposed site.Note: Please submit a copy of an Ordnance Survey based site location plan scaled 1:1250 with the application site outlined in red and adjoining land owned by applicant in blue, showing at least two road frontages and a North point.

Please provide the proposed block plan to show the poistion of the proposed works.Note: Please provide a copy of block plan drawn at an identified standard metric scale (such as 1:200 or 1:500) showing the proposed works (hatched or shaded) in relation to the existing dwelling, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site.  The block plan must show the direction of North and should also show adjoining properties to the side and rear and those opposite in full outline.
Only one side elevation drawing has been submitted. Please submit a drawing of the other side elevation.

The site address in the submitted application form is ''69 Hampden Road'', whereas the red outline in the location plan is ''73 Hampden Road'' in our record. Please amend the application form and location plan with the correct site address.
